alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Lunenburg; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cumberland, Prince Edward and northwestern Lunenburg Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pamplin City to Madisonville to near Aspen. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Darlington Heights around 300 PM EDT. Prospect around 310 PM EDT. Hampden Sydney College and Hampden Sydney around 325 PM EDT. Farmville and Longwood University around 330 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Kingsville, Briery Creek Lake, Tuggle, Elam, Reeds, Briery, Virso, Meherrin, Allens Mill and Simplicity. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
